title_sort: walt whitman to john burroughs, 27 march [1879]
title: Walt Whitman to John Burroughs, 27 March [1879]
text: Camden New JerseyMarch 27 p mMy dear friendI could not conveniently come to the West Phil: Depot—I have just written to Johnston leaving the hall, &c to his selection (the night too, if necessary)—I am averse to a first class hall—(I shall certainly be on hand, if alive & able, but the thing is yet a prospecting, & we are not at all sure what we shall find.)I am as usual—was over to Phila: last evening to a nice dinner party, all men, artists, &c, Horace Furness, (a good fellow)—his brother Frank, architect—my friend Forney—Kirke, (of Lippincott's Mag:) & eight or ten others—a jolly time—No imminent intention of going south or to California—Love to all inquiring Wash'n friends—W W Walt Whitman to John Burroughs, 27 March [1879]
